intro: Melicope floribunda, commonly known as the Hawaiian melicope, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a distinct, glandular texture. Melicope floribunda is also known for its role in traditional Hawaiian medicine and its ecological importance in native forests.
